revised_title: Meteoric Iron and Its Connection to Otumpa Iron
tldr: The author, Woodbine Parish, investigates the identity of a large mass of meteoric iron in the British Museum and its connection to the Otumpa Iron described by Rubin de Celis in 1786. He traces the history of the iron, which was brought to Buenos Aires and used to make pistols before being sent to the British Museum. The author provides a detailed account of the iron's origin and use, and suggests that it may be worth making known to the Royal Society.
